gemini-2.0-flash-exp.label: Next generation features, speed, and multimodal generation for a diverse variety of tasks
gemini-2.0-flash-exp.data: Latest update: Dec 2024, Knowledge cutoff: Aug 2024

gemini-1.5-flash.label: Fast and versatile performance across a diverse variety of tasks

gemini-1.5-pro.label: Complex reasoning tasks requiring more intelligence

sonar.label: Lightweight offering with search grounding, quicker and cheaper than Sonar Pro

sonar-pro.label: Premier search offering with search grounding, supporting advanced queries and follow-ups.

sonar-reasoning.label: Premier search offering outputs CoT in its response as well.

sonar-reasoning-pro.label: Premier search offering outputs CoT in its response as well with search grounding, supporting advanced queries and follow-ups.

gpt-4o-mini.label: Our affordable and intelligent small model for fast, lightweight tasks. GPT-4o mini is cheaper and more capable than GPT-3.5 Turbo. Currently points to gpt-4o-mini-2024-07-18.

gpt-4o-mini-2024-07-18.label: Our affordable and intelligent small model for fast, lightweight tasks. GPT-4o mini is cheaper and more capable than GPT-3.5 Turbo.

gpt-4o.label: Our high-intelligence flagship model for complex, multi-step tasks. GPT-4o is cheaper and faster than GPT-4 Turbo. Currently points to gpt-4o-2024-08-06.

gpt-4o-2024-08-06.label: Latest snapshot that supports Structured Outputs. gpt-4o currently points to this version.

chatgpt-4o-latest.label: The chatgpt-4o-latest model version continuously points to the version of GPT-4o used in ChatGPT, and is updated frequently, when there are significant changes.

o1-preview.label: o1 series of large language models are trained with reinforcement learning to perform complex reasoning. o1 models think before they answer, producing a long internal chain of thought before responding to the user. o1-preview: reasoning model designed to solve hard problems across domains. Points to the most recent snapshot of the o1 model: o1-preview-2024-09-12
o1-preview.status_details: beta model: limited control of features and capabilities. Does not support system role. For details, see https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning

o1-preview-2024-09-12.label: Latest o1 model snapshot
o1-preview-2024-09-12.status_details: beta model: limited control of features and capabilities. Does not support system role. For details, see https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning

o1-mini.label: o1 series of large language models are trained with reinforcement learning to perform complex reasoning. o1 models think before they answer, producing a long internal chain of thought before responding to the user. o1-mini: faster and cheaper reasoning model particularly good at coding, math, and science. Points to the most recent o1-mini snapshot: o1-mini-2024-09-12
o1-mini.status_details: beta model: limited control of features and capabilities. Does not support system role. For details, see https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning

o1-mini-2024-09-12.label: Latest o1-mini model snapshot
o1-mini-2024-09-12.status_details: beta model: limited control of features and capabilities. Does not support system role. For details, see https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning

o1.label: o1: reasoning model designed to solve hard problems across domains. o1 series of large language models are trained with reinforcement learning to perform complex reasoning. o1 models think before they answer, producing a long internal chain of thought before responding to the user. o1 model supports both text and image inputs, and produces text outputs (including Structured Outputs). Points to: o1-2024-12-17
o1.status_details: beta model: limited control of features and capabilities. Does not support system role. For details, see https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning

o1-2024-12-17.label: o1: reasoning model designed to solve hard problems across domains. o1 series of large language models are trained with reinforcement learning to perform complex reasoning. o1 models think before they answer, producing a long internal chain of thought before responding to the user.
o1-2024-12-17.status_details: beta model: limited control of features and capabilities. Does not support system role. For details, see https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/reasoning

gpt-4-turbo.label: The latest GPT-4 Turbo model with vision capabilities. Currently points to gpt-4-turbo-2024-04-09.

gpt-4-turbo-2024-04-09.label: GPT-4 Turbo with Vision model. gpt-4-turbo currently points to this version.

gpt-4-turbo-preview.label: Currently points to gpt-4-0125-preview: The latest GPT-4 model intended to reduce cases of laziness where the model doesn’t complete a task. Returns a maximum of 4,096 output tokens.

gpt-4-0125-preview.label: GPT-4 Turbo preview model intended to reduce cases of laziness where the model doesn’t complete a task. Returns a maximum of 4,096 output tokens.

gpt-4-1106-preview.label: GPT-4 Turbo model featuring improved instruction following, JSON mode, reproducible outputs, parallel function calling, and more. Returns a maximum of 4,096 output tokens. This is a preview model.

gpt-4.label: Currently points to gpt-4-0613: Snapshot of gpt-4 from June 13th 2023 with improved function calling support.

gpt-4-0613.label: Snapshot of gpt-4 from June 13th 2023 with improved function calling support.

gpt-4-32k.label: Currently points to gpt-4-32k-0613: Snapshot of gpt-4-32k from June 13th 2023 with improved function calling support. This model was never rolled out widely in favor of GPT-4 Turbo.

gpt-4-32k-0613.label: Snapshot of gpt-4-32k from June 13th 2023 with improved function calling support. This model was never rolled out widely in favor of GPT-4 Turbo.

gpt-3.5-turbo-0125.label: The latest GPT-3.5 Turbo model with higher accuracy at responding in requested formats and a fix for a bug which caused a text encoding issue for non-English language function calls. Returns a maximum of 4,096 output tokens.

gpt-3.5-turbo.label: Currently points to gpt-3.5-turbo-0125: The latest GPT-3.5 Turbo model with higher accuracy at responding in requested formats and a fix for a bug which caused a text encoding issue for non-English language function calls. Returns a maximum of 4,096 output tokens.

gpt-3.5-turbo-1106.label: GPT-3.5 Turbo model with improved instruction following, JSON mode, reproducible outputs, parallel function calling, and more. Returns a maximum of 4,096 output tokens.

gpt-3.5-turbo-16k.label: Currently points to gpt-3.5-turbo-16k-0613: Snapshot of gpt-3.5-turbo from June 13th 2023. Will be deprecated on June 13, 2024.

gpt-3.5-turbo-0613.label: Snapshot of gpt-3.5-turbo from June 13th 2023. Will be deprecated on June 13, 2024.

gpt-3.5-turbo-16k-0613.label: Snapshot of gpt-3.5-16k-turbo from June 13th 2023. Will be deprecated on June 13, 2024.

dall-e-3.label: The latest DALL·E model released in Nov 2023. The maximum prompt length is 4000 characters.

dall-e-2.label: The previous DALL·E model released in Nov 2022. The maximum prompt length is 1000 characters.
